com.punchthrough.bean.sdk.upload

Class FirmwareImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.punchthrough.bean.sdk.upload.FirmwareImage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Chunk.Chunkable

    public abstract class FirmwareImage
extends java.lang.Object
implements Chunk.Chunkable
    Holds data for a single A or B firmware image.

      • crcShadow

        public int crcShadow()
        The CRC shadow of the image. This is always 0xFFFF.
        Returns:
        The CRC shadow of the image

      • version

        public int version()
        The version of the image. This is used to determine if an image is newer than another image.
        Returns:
        The version of the image

      • length

        public int length()
        The length of the image, in bytes.
        Returns:
        The length of the image

      • uniqueID

        public byte[] uniqueID()
        The user-defined unique ID for the image. Currently determines image type.
        Returns:
        The image's unique ID

      • reserved

        public byte[] reserved()
        The reserved bytes of the image. These are not currently used and usually return 0xFFFF.
        Returns:
        The image's reserved bytes

      • type

        public FirmwareImageType type()

        The FirmwareImageType of this image.

        Determined by uniqueID(), which is "AAAA" or "BBBB" for A and B images respectively. Images A and B are identical but occupy different areas of CC storage.

        Returns:
        FirmwareImageType.A, FirmwareImageType.B, or null if uniqueID() is not "AAAA" or "BBBB"

      • metadata

        public FirmwareMetadata metadata()

      • blockCount

        public int blockCount()
        Returns:
        The number of blocks in this firmware image

      • block

        public byte[] block(int index)
        Get a firmware block for this image. Blocks are made up of a UINT16 block index followed by a 16-byte data block.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the block to be returned
        Returns:
        The block at the given index

      • create

        public static FirmwareImage create(byte[] data)
                            throws ImageParsingException
        Parses a block of data into a new FirmwareImage.
        Parameters:
        data - The bytes of image data
        Returns:
        The FirmwareImage object for those bytes of data
        Throws:
        ImageParsingException - if the image is too short to be valid
